conclusion: To solve for the temperature at state A, we need to analyze the given information and use the ideal gas law.
The graph shows a linear relationship between volume V and temperature T.
The process from state O to state A is an isobaric process (constant pressure).
The line OA in the V-T diagram passes through the origin (0,0) and point A (TA, 0.4 m³).
The slope of this line represents the ratio V/T, which is constant for an isobaric process.
Point B has coordinates (300 K, 0.6 m³).
The slope of the line OB is calculated as 0.002 m³/K.
The slope is the same for the entire isobaric process, so it is also equal to VA/TA.
Substitute VA = 0.4 m³ into the slope equation and solve for TA.
